• Build a Video Portal in Rails – another show-and-tell by EnvyLabs, woopie!
  • Render templates out of controllers – from those things i will never know i need, until the end of the world will come. thanks @swombat! :)
  • “:dependent => :restrict”:http://railspikes.com/2009/8/19/activerecord-refererential-integrity-is-broken-let-s-fix-it – a small fix suggestion for referential destruction in rails. suggests a special mode that throws an exception when trying to destroy a parent with children.
  • RoutingError and AuthLogic – Crazy Chris suggest a unique way to handle 404 pages.
  • Icons search engines – now don’t tell me that icons are NOT the thing that takes you the most time to find.
  • Super Awesome jQuery drop down menu – Wicked.
  • How to create Javascript Objects – cool guide for us JS dummies.
  • Useful mod_rewrite tips you should know – Have i posted it before? oh well…
  • Scale my foot up your ass – this guy.. hates scaling.
  • Apigee – Manage your API, without the hussle.
  • 3 uber-bugs that will kick your ass – yeah, paying attention is the key to success.
  • Cleaner rails views – do it. :)
  • 5 reasons/tips to use ThinkingSphinx – And sphinx at all.
  • RailsRumble apps that deserve to be startups – Agree with most, although some of my choice-of-the-rumblers are missing from that list.
  • Railsify Ubuntu – Ubuntu adopts some of Rails concepts for development. yai.
  • Running tests a little faster – a quick hack for quicker tests.
  • Intro to JQuery custom validations – Awesome, just awesome.

GitHub Treasures

  • qusion – Using AMQP as a Queuing Backend for Web Apps Should Be Easy
  • Socialite – Easily share your content with other social networking sites.
  • hijack – Provides an irb session to an existing ruby process.
  • Satisfy! – a development-only utility function that you can use to quickly generate HTML for testing/debugging.
  • Google4r-checkout – Google Checkout library for Ruby.
  • current_request – This plugin sets the current Rails request object in a Thread local variable
    so you can use it in places where the controller (and thus the request) are not
    directly available. not sure if it’s a good idea thu…
  • iso_countries – rails plugin to store countries as ISO codes
